perturbation.original_text: PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT will provide on-going assistance to THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, with regard to technical, administrative and service-oriented issues relating to the utilization, transmission and maintenance of the PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content, as THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION may reasonably request. PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT will use its reasonable best efforts to ensure that the PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content is available at the request of THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION.
perturbation.changed_text: PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT will endeavor to provide assistance to THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION, with regard to technical, administrative and service-oriented issues relating to the utilization, transmission and maintenance of the PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content, as it sees fit. PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT will attempt to ensure that the PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT Content is available at the request of THE HENRY FILM AND ENTERTAINMENT CORPORATION.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'endeavor to provide', 'as it sees fit', and 'attempt to ensure' weaken the obligation of PACIFICAP ENTERTAINMENT to provide assistance and content availability. This introduces ambiguity and makes the level of support discretionary rather than a guaranteed service.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract - Fails to define clear performance standards making enforcement difficult under California contract law.

perturbation.original_text: Each party agrees to preserve and protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and not to disclose or use any applicable Confidential Information without the prior written consent of the other party; provided, however, that any party hereto may disclose to any other party or use any information which is: (i) already publicly known; (ii) discovered or created independently of any involvement with such party; (iii) otherwise learned through legitimate means other than from such party; or (iv) independently created by the receiving party without reference to the other party’s confidential information. Moreover, any party hereto may disclose any Confidential Information hereunder to such party’s agents, attorneys and other representatives or any court or competent jurisdiction or any other party empowered hereunder as reasonably required to resolve any dispute between the parties hereto. Both parties agree all aspects of this contract are confidential and shall not be disclosed to any third party.
perturbation.changed_text: Each party will generally respect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information and will consider not disclosing or using such Confidential Information without consulting the other party; however, each party may disclose or use information that: (i) is arguably publicly known; (ii) appears to be discovered independently; (iii) seems to be learned through legitimate means; or (iv) appears to be independently created. Moreover, disclosure is permitted to agents, attorneys, and courts as deemed necessary. Both parties aim to keep most aspects of this contract confidential.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'agrees to preserve and protect' with 'will generally respect' and 'will consider not disclosing' weakens the confidentiality obligation. The modifications to the exceptions – 'arguably', 'appears to be', 'seems to be' – introduce subjectivity. This significantly weakens the legally binding language of the confidentiality clause, making it difficult to enforce. The phrase 'aim to keep most aspects' makes the clause vague.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Uniform Trade Secrets Act (CUTSA) - The weakening of the confidentiality clause undermines the protections afforded to trade secrets under CUTSA.

perturbation.original_text: ALL DISPUTES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE SETTLED VIA BINDING ARBITRATION ACCORDING TO THE RULES AND REGULATIONS SET FORTH BY THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION IN SAN DIEGO COUNTY , THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA.
perturbation.changed_text: Any disputes arising out of this agreement may be resolved through arbitration according to generally accepted practices in San Diego County, California.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'SHALL BE SETTLED VIA BINDING ARBITRATION' to 'may be resolved through arbitration' makes arbitration optional instead of mandatory. Removing the reference to 'THE RULES AND REGULATIONS SET FORTH BY THE AMERICAN ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION' and replacing it with 'generally accepted practices' removes clarity and introduces significant ambiguity about the arbitration process. This undermines the enforceability of the arbitration clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Arbitration Act - Undermines the Act by making the arbitration process optional and ill-defined.
